top.title: Wolverine Worldwide CEO talks growth in 2026, AI and getting ‘better at telling stories’
top.snippet: The CEO of Wolverine Worldwide, owner of brands like Saucony and Merrell, believes the company has been generally very good at developing products. But, he said, "I think we have to get better at telling stories."
top.aiSummary:
AI-Generated Summary:
The CEO of Wolverine Worldwide discusses the company's growth in 2026, emphasizing the need to improve storytelling despite success in product development. (Source: Modern Retail, Published: 2025-12-24)

top.title: GSC Groups Keywords as AI Queries Expand
top.snippet:
Google Search Console's "Insights" section no longer shows click trends for single keywords, only by group. 
The post GSC Groups Keywords as AI Queries Expand appeared first on Practical Ecommerce.
top.aiSummary: AI-generated summary: Google Search Console's "Insights" section now groups keywords instead of showing click trends for individual keywords, reflecting the expansion of AI queries.

Shopify Integrates AI Product Discovery
top.snippet:
Shopify's new Agentic Storefronts means even the smallest merchants can sell via ChatGPT, Perplexity, Microsoft Copilot, and more.
The post Shopify Integrates AI Product Discovery appeared first on Practical Ecommerce.
top.aiSummary: AI-generated summary: Shopify's Agentic Storefronts now allow small merchants to utilize AI tools like ChatGPT, Perplexity, and Microsoft Copilot for product discovery, as reported by Practical Ecommerce.

top.title: A look at retail’s year of AI news
top.snippet: Retail may be lagging behind other industries in the adoption of artificial intelligence, but 2025 was still transformative. Here’s a recap of retail’s biggest AI-related news this year.
top.aiSummary:
AI-Generated Summary:
In 2025, retail experienced significant advancements in artificial intelligence despite lagging behind other industries in adoption. Retail Dive provides a recap of the biggest AI-related news in the retail sector for the year.

top.title: Dollar Shave Club’s first AI-generated ad makes tech the punchline
top.snippet: The brand and partner Too Short for Modeling leveraged AI to animate complex visuals while keeping to a development timeline of just a few weeks.
top.aiSummary: AI-generated ad by Dollar Shave Club and Too Short for Modeling uses AI to animate visuals quickly, showcasing tech as the punchline in the campaign.

top.title: Twins’ Peaks: The Gilbertson Brothers Want to Rewrite Your Country’s Map
top.snippet: Two brothers, both mechanical engineers, are climbing many of the world’s tall peaks to prove they have been measured incorrectly.
top.aiSummary:
AI-Generated Summary:
The Gilbertson brothers, mechanical engineers, are challenging the accuracy of measurements of tall peaks by climbing them, aiming to rewrite the maps of various countries.

top.title: From A.I. to Chips, Big Tech Is Getting What It Wants From Trump
top.snippet: The president has backed policies that allow the industry to grow unfettered. The mutually beneficial alliance is causing concern among some conservatives.
top.aiSummary:
AI-Generated Summary:
President Trump's policies have supported the growth of Big Tech, leading to a mutually beneficial relationship that is causing concern among some conservatives.

top.title: Before Electric Vehicles Became Political, There Was the Toyota Prius
top.snippet: The political polarization of battery-powered cars may have started when Toyota released its first hybrid model 25 years ago.
top.aiSummary:
AI-generated summary:
The Toyota Prius, released 25 years ago, is seen as the starting point for the political polarization surrounding electric vehicles.

top.title: The K-shaped economy is forcing luxury brands to pick a side
top.snippet: Amid a K-shaped economy, fashion and luxury brands are rethinking pricing, experience and who they are really building for.
